column1: Cheltenham is a suburb of Adelaide
column2: South Australia. It is located in the City of Charles Sturt.

column1: The suburb lies between Port Road and Cheltenham Parade
column2: which form its southwest and eastern boundaries respectively. The suburb is split in two by the Outer Harbor railway line.

column1: Cheltenham Post Office opened on 8 February 1897 and closed in 1910.
The 2006 Census by the Australian Bureau of Statistics counted 2
column2: 175 persons in Cheltenham on census night. Of these
column3: 50.4% were male and 49.6% were female.The majority of residents (77.1%) are of Australian birth
column4: with other common census responses being England (4.8%) and Italy (2.5%).The age distribution of Cheltenham residents is similar to that of the greater Australian population. 68.5% of residents were over 25 years in 2006
column5: compared to the Australian average of 66.5%; and 31.5% were younger than 25 years
column6: compared to the Australian average of 33.5%.

column1: Cheltenham is part of Woodville Ward in the City of Charles Sturt local government area
column2: being represented in that council by Oanh Nguyen and Robert Grant.

column1: Cheltenham lies in the state electoral district of Cheltenham and the federal electoral division of Port Adelaide. The suburb is represented in the South Australian House of Assembly by Jay Weatherill and federally by Mark Butler.
